definitions.definition: Moving with speed, rapidity or swiftness, or capable of doing so; rapid; fast.
Occurring in a short time; happening or done rapidly.

definitions.example: You have to be very quick to be able to compete in ad-lib theatrics.
My father is old but he still has a quick wit.

definitions.definition: Of temper: easily aroused to anger; quick-tempered.
definitions.example: He is wont to be rather quick of temper when tired.

definitions.definition: Pregnant, especially at the stage where the foetus's movements can be felt; figuratively, alive with some emotion or feeling.
(of a vein of ore) productive; not "dead" or barren
